oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-10-05 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 5, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performers Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles, and regular performers Pete Stamper (his first appearance), Rufus Thibodeaux, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 939th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: June Carter; Bill Carlisle; Carlisles; Del Wood; Jim Reeves; Jordanaires
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Jim Reeves introduces June Carter -- Comedy routine (June Carter, Jim Reeves) -- Prince Albert commercial (June Carter, Jim Reeves) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Jim Reeves introduces Bill Carlisle -- Something Different (Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles) -- Jim Reeves introduces Del Wood -- Chinese Breakdown (Del Wood) -- Jim Reeves talks -- Four Walls (Jim Reeves, Jordanaires) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Jim Reeves) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements -- Noel Hotel commercial (Grant Turner) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Stamper, Pete, 1930-; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Thibodeaux, Rufus, 1934-; Reeves, Jim; Carlisle, Bill; Carlisles (Musical group)
